Params[3]: Despite the resemblance, this ship is not in very good condition.
Oh, they say this ship is the sister ship of that Kua-Er grade ship.
But the configuration of its propulsion system was never finished because of the virus.

Params[2]: So that's why they look so alike?

Params[3]: Probably. Anyway, it's impossible to sail it out of here now.
Even if we manage to get it onto the water...
How long can we expect a ship without power, displacement, or even sea valves to stay afloat?
Simply put, until we find the lair of the Corrupted attacking us, the fishermen will not be safe.
Even though my boss says Abyssea is capable of handling its own affairs...
But that's just him playing tough. He's probably thinking about hiring people he normally can't afford...
Or even selling us to the Ascendants, like Akdilek did.
But how come you still contacted Babylonia?
Well, one day when I was selling fish, I heard from a merchant that Babylonia offered help to Akdilek.
So I thought, "What if they're willing to help us too?"
If you can complete this mission, then I'll be able to convince the Abyssea Shipyard to accept help from Babylonia.
Anyway, this is all that Celica lady's idea, huh?
I'm not sure why would she be so kind as to help us, but I, Devil 7, will not let her down!
Okay then, let's start by searching the abandoned ships here!
